reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching style is normal, and the teaching speed is  acceptable.
The instructor is good.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm (38%) MCs and Problems
Final (57%) MCs and Problems   
PRS (5%) Answering questions with PRS in lectures
The PRS questions are easy if you listen to the lectures( often possible to find the answer after you see the question)
The midterm and final are not very hard, but it needs much preparation and a little physics background.
The grading is acceptable(not very bad), and if you study hard, it will not be hard to get an A range.
reviews.comment_workload:
No assignments and optional homework only.
The only workload is the preparation for cheat sheet for the exams which takes quite a long time.

reviews.author: Tony Chau
reviews.comment_content:
Syllabus: origin of modern astronomy, gravity, light and telescope, star light and atoms, stars (binary, formation, evolution, death), neutron stars and black holes, normal galaxies, peculiar galaxies, cosmology, the solar system, life on other world
Material: lecture notes and assignment for self practice (not graded)
Attendance: iPRS question at the end of each lecture
reviews.comment_teaching: Good teaching, very clear explanation
reviews.comment_grading:
Possibly one of the courses with the most beautiful grade
Midterm +1.5 SD, final +1.1 SD = A+
reviews.comment_workload: Possibly one of the courses with the least workload. No workload, only attendance and exams

reviews.author: Jacky 01
reviews.title: Quite easy and low workload
reviews.comment_content: Before the mid-term, it is quite easy. Most of the concept can be understand by knowledge of secondary physics even though you didn't choose astronomy as elective subject. After the mid-term the content will talk about the birth of universe, galaxy ,stars, black hole, dark matter etc. The concept will be a little bit hard but still acceptable.
reviews.comment_teaching: Most of them are power point reading. But the video and simulation in the power point is helpful for you to understand the concept. But still that doesn't means that you can skip lecture because it has iprs every lecture.
reviews.comment_grading: It is very easy to get B. Actually most of the student can get above mean in their exam and mid-term. But the standard deviation is very large, so getting A grade require you to get very high marks. Also the iprs occupy 5% of the total marks. Most of the question are quite easy so it is very easy to get full marks. So I suggest don't skip them.
reviews.comment_workload: There will be no homework, lab or project. Just mid-term, final exam and iprs. Cheat sheet is allowed in the exam. One A4 paper for mid-term and 2 A4 for final exam. Both side can be used. It can be printed or written. Most of the exam and mid-term are MC, with 2-3 long question. And also, the coverage of mid-term will NOT be included in the exam. So not a lot of workload for revision.

reviews.author: Lawrence Chak
reviews.title: Review on the renowned PHYS 1002
reviews.comment_content:
One of the best contents if you are into astronomy stuff
Especially if you have studied the astronomy electives in DSE.
Having M2 plus physics in DSE will make your life much easier.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Pretty nice teaching overall.
Professors are really nice people, you can ask as much question as you want after classes.
reviews.comment_grading:
The mid term and exam are easy enough if you studied with some amount of effort.
Great grade courses.
Not yet received grades but heard it from other seniors.
reviews.comment_workload:
The same words apply here, if you love astronomy, stars, and cosmos stuff, you won't be having many problems here.
In fact,  you may actually want more reference text to read to.

reviews.author: Alvin Leung bb
reviews.comment_content: The early parts of the courses are already covered in high school physics elective part. The overall content is not difficult, but vasic physics knowledge is needed.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is quite boring. However, the movie viewing session is very interesting, especially for those who are very interested in or have more knowledge in astronomy.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is good.
reviews.comment_workload: Only 1 final. However, a new syllabus includes 30% iPRS, meaning that you need to pay a lot of attention during class. Moreover, there is a movie viewing session that counts attendance.

reviews.author: YSA
reviews.comment_content:
Topics include:
A Modern View of the Universe
Discovering the Universe for Yourself
The Science of Astronomy
Understanding Motion, Energy, and Gravity
Light and Matter
Telescopes
Our Star
Surveying the Stars
Star Birth
Stellar Graveyard
Our Galaxy
Galaxies and the Foundation of Modern Cosmology Galaxy Evolution
The Birth of the Universe
Dark Matter, Dark Energy, and the Fate of the Universe
The course content is quite easy and not too much, even without any background in astronomy or advanced math/physics. It's quite fun if you are interested in this subject, especially the 2nd half of the course which focuses on stars, galaxies, cosmology.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is quite clear and explains concepts well, also tried to make the content more fun and relevant to us. But sometimes the lectures can be boring and a lot of people don't attend, especially since he only reads from the PPTs which are uploaded online.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm (38%)
Final (57%)
PRS (5%)
The grading is quite good. PRS is easy to get nearly full. Midterm and Final are not that difficult with a little revision and preparing good cheat sheets with all formulae.
I got above mean in PRS, slightly below mean in Midterm, >1.5 SD above mean in Final: overall grade A.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is almost 0. No homework or assignments of any kind. Only need to attend lectures for PRS at the end. Exams do not require much studying, spend more time preparing a good cheat sheet because most of the short answer questions in both exams are simple calculations using formulae, which are not provided.

reviews.author: HONGMIN
reviews.title: Quite a easy lecture
reviews.comment_content:
Good and enough content
making contents easy to understand
In first lecture, he explained some concepts really grasply,
so I have a confidence to take this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
His teaching way is quite a easy.

reviews.comment_grading: I didnt finished his course yet, so youd better consider other people's opinion.

About workload, it sounds like a little bit tough.
But I think it is much easier than other courses in ust.
